title: Hybrid Mathematics Education Program for Developing Attitudes Based on Religious Ethical Values (K-12)

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics fundamentals and basic religious etiquette
context.additional_context: A program to address affective domain deficiencies caused by unstructured learning post-COVID-19. Integrating religious ethical values (excellence, honesty, responsibility, sharing) into mathematical problem-solving processes

learning_goals: Learners can recognize and explain the four prophetic virtues (excellence, integrity, responsibility, and sharing) in the math problem-solving process.
Learners can experience ethical decision-making processes through peer collaboration projects and document reflections in journals.
Learners can concretely propose ethical value implementation plans in digital tool-based math modeling activities.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
